value: All merchants will have BOTs
A village is quite similar to a tribe. It is a large community of people with shared interests. The difference is that villages are private and new members can only be added by invitation📨.
There are no specific types of villages&#x1F937&#x200D&#x2642&#xFE0F.
Clans are private groups created by users. When creating a clan (group), the admin of the clan must specify a unique name and clan category which cannot be changed
There are currently 13 categories in Habari: Fashion, Health & Fitness, Books, Science, Travel, Sports, News, Politics, DIY(Do It Yourself), Music, Technology, Food & Movies/TV

A user cannot change clan name, username, tribe name or village name and certain names are reserved for featured tribes /merchants so users cannot use them during registration e.g. Shoprite, Slot, Guardian News etc.
A verified tribe is a tribe that is internally managed by Habari.

Featured tribes are tribes for selected merchants to advertise their products and services. Merchants will pay to be featured as tribes. These merchants can post offers on discounted products also called deals and general information about goods and services offered. Non-profit organization and charities can also be Featured tribes and all Habari users will be allowed to make donations on their pages.
Anyone 13 and above can use Habari&#x1F601

A clan becomes a tribe after it attains X+ number of members and goes public. Whenever a clan attains the tribe status, members of the parent tribe they fall under will be notified of the change and asked if they’ll like to be part of the new tribe
Tribes are large public community of people that share similar interests, users are introduced to tribes during onboarding and can join more tribes afterwards.
There are 3 types of tribes: verified tribes, 'clan-tribe' tribes and featured tribes.

Habari is a virtual platform that connects people with shared interests and enables them to discover new interests. Interact with friends, create Tribes and populate them, share information and grow within the Habari Kingdom. Become a Prince or Princess and have a shot at becoming a Habari ruler and get the title, perks and a chance to sit on a real Habari throne. Trade to earn gold coins, which can be redeemed within our virtual world. Make monetary transactions and payments from Habari to your real world contacts and merchants.

Habari offers a wide range of benefits such as:
Discounts on all merchant deals
Rewards with Habari Gold Coins and no charges for transactions on Habari
Individual and business marketing
Fun and engaging one stop platform for socializing, ecommerce, gaming, business and news.

Merchant and Verified tribes’ posts are controlled, only an admin can post in these tribes. Followers can only like, share, comment and or buy posts. While ‘clan - tribe’ tribes have the option to enable or disable post by tribe members.
A tribe can be created by Habari Admin and, existing clans with X number of active members can rise to become a tribe.
Habari's core functions are individual/corporate bloging, video/audio chatting, music listening, requesting/sending money & purchasing discounted items.
Multiple device login will be allowed with phone number authentication&#x1F4F1&#x1F4F2.
Clans will have expiry dates&#x23F0, after which if there’s no activity and several notifications sent to the admin of the clan, it will be deleted.
Clans can be deleted by their admin but tribes cannot be deleted.
Users cannot create a clan with an existing clan or tribe name.

A village is a private tribe where members join by invitation unlike a tribe which is public and anyone can join. Going public makes it faster for a transitioned clan to get discovered and grow to have more followers as users can easily search and add themselves to the tribe instead of requesting to be added.
The two leaderboards in Habari are Kingdom Leaderboards and Tribe Leaderboards.
A Kingdom Leaderboard is place where all of Habari's activities are summarized e.g. total number of prince/princesses in the kingdom, total number of tribes.

This contains the number of people in a tribe and name of the Tribe leaders i.e. the member of the tribe with the most influence (likes, shares, or comments for user’s posts). Members of tribes will be notified when they have a new tribe’s leader.

Kinsman: 0 - 4,000 Points
Farmer: >4,000 - 9,000 Points
Hunter: >9,000 - 15,000 Points
Warrior: >15,000 - 23,000 Points
Nobleman: >23,000 - 33,000 Points
Elder: >33,000 - 48,000 Points
Chief: >48,000 - 70,000 Points
Prince/Princess: >=70,000 Points
Emperor: Competitive Title
This is an entry level title for a user who has successfully created an account and rewarded with 100 pts. 0 - 4,000 Points
A Farmer is a Kinsman who has earned additional 5,000 points. 4,000 - 9,000 Points
A Hunter is a Farmer who has earned additional 6,000 points. 9,000 - 15,000 Points
A Warrior is a Hunter who has earned additional 8,000 points. 15,000 - 23,000 Points
An Elder is a Nobleman who has earned additional 15,000 points. 33,000 - 48,000 Points
A Chief is an Elder who has earned additional 22,000 points. 48,000 - 70,000 Points
A Prince/Princess is a Chief who has earned additional 30,000 points. >=70,000 Points

The point system in Habari allows users in move between the different hierarchies. Points are background activity based rewards that allows users to move in hierarchy. Every user has a point meter system to track their hierarchy progression in the Habari kingdom

This is the highest title in the Habari Kingdom, it is a competitive title as there can be only one emperor at any given time who can be dethroned by any of the existing prince or princesses with a minimum of 100,000 HGC and an additional 5,000 points more than the reigning emperor. Some of the perks of being Emperor are:
Weekly airtime
Instant gifts (promotional items, physical gold coins, lapel pins)
Exclusive parties
Points
Habari Gold Coins
Merchant sponsored prizes
HGC(Habari Gold Coins) are activity and transaction based virtual currencies and rewards with a limited amount available for in-app purchases at discounted prices.

Coins can be used in various ways:
1. Make purchases from Merchants at discounted prices.
2. Make purchases from virtual shops to buy virtual objects e.g. virtual roses, themes.
3. Donate to non-profit merchants.
4. HGC can be used to play games e.g. challenge a king, game of chance
5. Nullify wrong doings i.e. give out HGC instead of points deduction for certain mistakes.

Coins can be earned in various ways:
1. By going up in the Habari hierarchy
2. Performing card transactions | ₦0 to ₦500 airtime = 2,000 HGC, > ₦500 = 5,000 HGC and transfers = 10,000 HGC.
3. Transfer of HGC among users within Habari
4. Playing and winning different Habari games
5. Earning the Don badge. Don badge = 3000 HGC
6. Bonus HGC can also be given randomly to users on a certain hierarchy. For example, there can be a promo where all warriors are rewarded with X HGC

Points can be earned through the following ways:
Onboarding
Adding a profile picture (1st time)
Updating status (1st time)
Adding a card (1st time)
Adding a friend
Create a group with more than 3 people existing for over 72 hours
Join a tribe
Joining a Tribe
Chatting with anyone/group
Public posts in Tribes
Liking pictures
Receiving likes
Posts getting up to Moments
Funding a wallet
Purchasing Airtime
Transfers
Sharing Posts
Clan moving up to a Tribe
Buying Habari Gold Coins
Commenting on posts
Buying deals
Downloading playlists
Challenges

<b>A user can be demoted&#x2B07 in hierarchy after 4 weeks of inactivity in Habari. The number of points deducted depends on a user’s hierarchy. If a user is new to a tribe and remains inactive for over 8 weeks, he/she will be exiled from that tribe.

Badges are an app-wide, activity based gratification system. When a user receives a badge, it’s added to their profile and they can also share it within their clans, tribes, and outside the application. There are various types of badges

The following are the types of badges available in Habari and their meanings:
Newbie - Complete registration / onboarding
Photophresh - Upload a profile picture for the first time
Swipe Master - Add a card to profile for the first time
Thick Wallet - Add money to virtual wallet for the first time
Swag - Customize profile for the first time
Buzz - Share X number of posts outside the app
Socialite - Add X number of friends on Habari
Citizen - Spend a total of 100 hours on Habari
Chatterbox - Comment on 30 different posts
Baller - Make X number of successful transactions in Habari
Alpha - Create 5 active clans

Warrior In The Making - Have 500 posts within tribes
Influencer - 3,000 likes on posts in tribes
Explorer - Post from 3 different states based on app geo-tag
Spectator - Have a total of 500 likes on different posts
Squad - clan with a total of 5,000 messages.
Challenger - User who has attempted to challenge the reigning Emporer.
Don - The admin of a clan that becomes a tribe earns this badge.
Lord Of The Beatz - User has been active in the music tribe for 100 hours
Deals in Habari are discounted items put up by featured merchants for purchase. All items on Habari are on discount and are the best deals anywhere.

There are 2 types of deals in Habari:
1. Regular deals by Merchants: These are deals placed in the market square by merchants for purchase by followers.
2. Mega deals: These deals are not up for sale, users can only win these items by bidding for them.

The Marketsquare is where all deals can be viewed by users regardless of merchants they follow. It will feature top trending deals and merchants based on likes / comments and all other deals being posted on Habari, including deals from the Habari team. It is only opened to registered and verified merchants with all posted deals also appearing on their follower’s page.
You must contact the merchant directly for your cancellation request.

To start bidding on Habari for Mega deals:
1. Recharge your account with some HGC
2. Choose an item that you would like to win
3. Start bidding to find the lowest unique bid
4. Place a single bid by paying a low subscription fee or place multiple bids at a higher subscription fee (fees are in HGC)

The following transfer methods can be performed on Habari:
Habari P2P transfer: A user can transfer HGC to Naira to any of his contacts by selecting the contact’s profile and choosing the transfer funds option under it.
Wallet to Account Transfer: A user can move money from his wallet to his registered bank account card on Habari
Accoint to Account Transfers: A user can move funds from his bank account card to another user’s bank account card on Habari.
Group Payments: Members of a clan can make group payments by setting a goal, amount, timeframe. Afterwards, a bar will track progress of group goal and members who have paid towards goal.
<b>The currently Verfied Tribes in Habari are - Habari Sports, Habari Music & Habari News.

Your contacts are people on your contact list who are already on Habari and who have accepted your connection request. You can as well send a download link to poeple who are not on Habari and later on add them as a Habari contact.
To sign out from Habari, simply go to the profile page and scroll all the way down. There, you will see the sign out button.
To exit the app, simply press the home button on your phone.

To become a merchant you have to contact the Habari team to begin the verification process and if successful, you are given your Habari merchant credentials else, you can contact Habari team to put your deals for sale in the market square.

You can contact a merchant through our internal messaging system by clicking on the link 'Contact Merchant' located on any of the deal item pages. You can also check the merchant’s tribe page to see if they have included additional contact information in their tribe.

To access your profile, tap on the Habari Button to display the five fingers of Habari then tap on the last finger with your picture (or avatar if you’ve not uploaded any picture) to access your profile page.
To view notifications, tap on the Habari Button to display the five fingers of Habari then tap on the second finger with a bell icon.
To import contacts, tap on Settings > Import Contacts then follow the instructions to import contacts.

To add contacts, tap on the Habari Button to display the five fingers of Habari then tap on the fourth finger to display your Habari Contacts. Next, tap on my contacts to view all contacts on phone and then tap the + icon to send a friend request to the user
To view groups you are in, go to your profile page then tap on the group icon to arrive at the group page
To create a group, go to your profile page then tap on the group icon to arrive at the group page. After that, click on the 'Create A Clan' button

To add someone to a group, go to your profile page then tap on the group icon snd select the group you would like to add someone to. Tap the '+' button at the top of the page then choose user(s) from your list to invite to the group and select Add.

To leave a group, firstly, open the group in which you are a member. Go to the group profile page by tapping on the group profile picture at the top of the screen. Tap on the X icon at the top left corner of the screen and then tap on 'Exit Group'.

To remove a member from a group (as an administrator&#128273), firstly, open the group in which you are an administrator. Go to the group profile page by tapping on the group profile picture at the top of the screen. Tap on the X icon next to the user you want to delete from the group and then finally tap on 'Remove from group'.
Your phone number is your account number on Habari and cannot be changed🙈

Queen Hekima was the first Queen of the Habari Kingdom. She was very wise and just, and greatly adored by her subjects and the people, after many years of a prosperous and peaceful reign in the kingdom, she grew old and died

Prince Kikao was a Habari royal chosen by the people as Queen Hekima's successor and ascended the throne. He unearthed large quantities of gold, ushering in a new era of wealth in the kingdom. The people were happy until his mysterious disappearance leaving a treasury of 3 billion Gold Coins and the princes and princesses of the kingdom challenging each other to take his place on the throne for ultimate influence and wealth.
